result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Gear was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge, and $500.00 image surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS APPLY TO EACH COUNT:  
Recommended mental health treatment and programs.

No unsupervised contact with persons under the age of 18 years.
No personal computer use of other social media devices.

Participate in sex offender assessment and treatment programs.
Register as a sex offender.
Take all prescribed medications.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant:  as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privilegse are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Provide DNA sample for the data bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Credit for 132 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A Gear

defendant.name: Gear, Joseph A
defendant.address: 3301 West Denton Avenue, St Francis, WI 53235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (14 pages) commencing 7/22/14 SENTENCING received and filed.

Defendant Joseph A Gear in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Defendant Joseph A Gear in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  
AS to count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 132 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.
AS to count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 132 days time served, concurrent with count 1.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
AS TO EACH COUNT:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Pay a $500 image surcharge.
-Participate in sex offender assessment and treatment programs.
-Register as a sex offender.
-Recommended mental health treatment and programs.
-NO unsupervised contact with persons under the age of 18 years.
-NO personal computer use or other social media devices.
-Take all prescribed medications.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Clerk contacted attys that PSI is available for pick up.

At the request of Probation department, due to increased number of PSI requests, the date for PSI to be returned to court is changed to 7-17-2014 and the sentencing date is changed to 7-22-2014 at 8:15am.
ADA Jennifer Williams and Atty William Reddin are advised of date change and are available.

Defendant Joseph A Gear in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Defendant Joseph A Gear in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS to counts 1 and 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty. Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Court orders counts 3 through 10 dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Court orders PSI and remands the defendant  for sentencing on 7-1-2014 at 8:15.

Attorney William J Reddin in court, defendant Joseph A Gear not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel is requesting a projected plea date of 6-2-2014 t 8:15am

Attorney William J Reddin in court, defendant Joseph A Gear not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has provided an offer and an additional 100 pages of discovery.  Defense MAY be entering an NGI plea on the next date.  Defense is requesting a brief adjournment to review new discovery with defendant and decide how to proceed.  Case is adjourned to 5-12-2014 for status/scheduling; defendant to be produced for next date.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to all counts.  Discovery is provided to counse.  ADA Williams is to provide offer to counsel.  Case adjourned to Br. 38 on 4-21-2014 at 8:15 for scheduling conference.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant Joseph A Gear in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Defendant Joseph A Gear in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for Jennifer Williams for the State of Wisconsin.
Report of Dr. Pankiewicz is reviewed by all parties.  There are no challenges to the report by the state, defense or defendant.  The Court will adopt the opinion of doctor and will find the defendant is now competent to proceed.  Court will reinstate proceedings and the previous cash bail of $7500.00 with same conditions of release.
Report of Dr. Pankiewicz dated 4-8-2014 received and filed.

Defendant Joseph A Gear in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Defendant Joseph A Gear in custody.  Karl Hayes for Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Oral No Contact Order with PORNOGRAPHY AND UNSUPERVISED CONTACT WITH CHILDREN UNDER 17 YEARS OF AGE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Joseph A Gear in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Joseph A Gear in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
